roblem is exactly why categories of tests should be a concept
that is compl=
etely separate from the package, class or even method name.

In other words=
, you should be able to specify the following two concepts:

- The name of =
the method
- The class they belong to
- The packages your classes belong to=


and

- The category of your tests

in an orthogonal way.

Very often, you=
 will find some overlap (all your "database" tests will end
up belonging to=
 the same package) but it should by no means be a
requirement.

For example=
, "functional" is a good example of a group that cross-cuts all
the areas o=
f your tests.  Test methods that are part of this group are going
to be sca=
ttered all across your packages and file system.  The testing
framework sho=
uld give you maximum flexibility to specify this without being
intrusive on=
 how you name your classes or methods.
